IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE BRING VIBRANT PROFESSIONAL THEATRE AND DRAMATIC EDUCATION BEYOND THE BOUNDARIES OF BOSTON, FEATURING WORLD AND REGIONAL PREMIERES ALONGSIDE FRESH INTERPRETATIONS OF FAMILIAR WORK. WITHIN THIS SETTING,WE UNIQUELY FOSTER FUTURE ARTISTS THROUGH THE EDUCATION PROGRAM.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE BRING VIBRANT PROFESSIONAL THEATRE AND DRAMATIC EDUCATION BEYOND THE BOUNDARIES OF BOSTON, FEATURING WORLD AND REGIONAL PREMIERES ALONGSIDE FRESH INTERPRETATIONS OF FAMILIAR WORK. WITHIN THIS SETTING,WE UNIQUELY FOSTER FUTURE ARTISTS THROUGH THE EDUCATION PROGRAM.
IRS990.Desc: MAINSTAGE PROGRAM: WE PRODUCE 6-7 SHOWS EACH YEAR AS PART OF OURMAINSTAGE SERIES AT GREATER BOSTON STAGE COMPANY. AS A PROFESSIONALNOT-FOR-PROFIT REGIONAL THEATRE WE WORK WITH THE HIGHEST CALIBER OFPROFESSIONAL ACTORS, DIRECTORS AND DESIGNERS TO CREATE THE HIGHESTQUALITY THEATRE POSSIBLE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONCERT PROGRAMS: DESPITE BUSY MAINSTAGE & EDUCATION SEASONS, THETHEATRE ROUNDS OUT ITS OFFERINGS WITH CONCERT & RENTAL EVENTS AS THESCHEDULE ALLOWS. THESE SPECIAL EVENTS TEND TO DRAW A VERY DIFFERENTAUDIENCE, WHICH ALLOWS THE THEATRE TO SERVE A BROADER POPULATION.ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROGRAMMING CONTRIBUTES TO THE THEATRE'S BOTTOM LINEHELPING TO SUPPORT THE MORE ADVENTUROUS PRODUCTIONS IN THE MAINSTAGESEASON.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: EDUCATION PROGRAM: OUR EDUCATION PROGRAM, THE YOUNG COMPANY BELIEVESTHAT GOOD THEATRE MAKES GOOD PEOPLE. WE PROVIDE YEAR-ROUND TRAINING ANDPERFORMANCE OPPORTUNITIES TO STUDENTS IN GRADES 1-12 WITH A VITALCONNECTION TO OUR PROFESSIONAL COMPANY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE OVERALL FINANCIAL OBJECTIVE FOR THE ASSETS OF THE ENDOWMENT FUND IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE THEATRE AND THEREBY THE GENERAL PUBLIC, WHICH BENEFITS FROM THE CULTURAL AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES OFFERED BY THE THEATRE. THE THEATRE WILL USE THE INCOME FROM THE FUND TO ACCOMPLISH ITS MISSION AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part X : FIN48 Footnote
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE THEATRE IS ORGANIZED AND OPERATED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE ANDEDUCATIONAL PURPOSES. INCOME RELATED TO THESE PURPOSES IS EXEMPT FROMFEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF SECTION 501(C)(3)OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME WOULD BE TAXABLEACCORDING TO APPLICABLE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTIONS.THE THEATRE REGULARLY REVIEWS AND EVALUATES ITS PROVISIONS TAKEN IN ITS FILED RETURNS AND RECOGNIZES THE BENEFIT FROM A TAX PROVISION ONLY IF IT IS MORE THAN LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE POSTION WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON AUDIT BASED SOLELY ON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE TAX POSITON. THE THEATRE ACCRUES INTEREST AND PENALTIES ON UNCERTAIN POSITIONS AS A COMPONENT OF THE PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES.THE THEATRE FILES FEDERAL AND MASSACHUSETTS TAX RETURNS. THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR THESE JURISDICTIONS IS GENERALLY THREE YEARS. THE THEATRE HAD NO RETURNS UNDER EXAMINATION AS OF JUNE 30, 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COST OF GOODS SOLD $1897

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COST OF GOOD SOLD $1897

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule L, Part V Supplemental Information
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCH L, PART IV, BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS INVOLVING INTERESTED PERSONS:(A) NAME OF PERSON: SYMES FAMILY FOUNDATION(B) RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN INTERESTED PERSON AND ORGANIZATION:THE ARTISTIC DIRECTOR AND A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, FAMILY OWNS THE FOUNDATION(C) AMOUNT OF TRANSACTION $ 190,872. LEASE VALUE WAS DONATED.(D) DESCRIPTION OF TRANSACTION: NON-CANCELABLE OPERATING LEASE FORSPACE.(E) SHARING OF ORGANIZATION REVENUES? = NO

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WEYLIN SYMES, ARTISIC DIRECTOR, AND ARICIA SYMES-ELMER, A TRUSTEE, ARE SIBLINGS.THE CURRENT PRESIDENT AND A TRUSTEE HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE RECEIVES THE COMPLETED DRAFT FORM 990 TO REVIEW AND SUBMITS COMMENTS AND QUESTIONS TO THE ACCOUNTANTS WHO PREPARE THE RETURN. ONCE THE QUESTIONS ARE ADEQUATELY ANSWERED AND IS APPROVED BY FINANCE COMMITTEE, ANY QUESTIONS OR CONCERNS WILL BE NOTED AND ADDRESSED, AND SENOIR MANAGEMENT WILL ENSURE THAT CHANGES ARE INCORPORATED INTO THE FORM 990 AS APPROPRIATE BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, TRUSTEES, AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE OR UPDATE ANNUALLY THEIR INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, SUCH AS A LIST OF FAMILY MEMBERS,SUBSTANTIAL BUSINESS OR INVESTMENT HOLDINGS, AND OTHER TRANSACTIONS OR AFFILIATIONS WITH BUSINESSES AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND THOSE OF FAMILY MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE STARTING SALARIES FOR THE ARTISTIC AND MANAGING DIRECTORS ARE ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. ONCE CONTRACTED, FUTURE RAISES ARE RECOMMENDED BY MANAGEMENT AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD THROUGH THE BUDGETING PROCESS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 18: Explanation of Other Means Forms Available For Public Inspection
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AND FORM 1023 AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION AS REQUIRED UNDER SECTION 6104 OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE UPON REQUEST;GUIDESTAR.ORG; MASS. ATTORNEY GENERAL WEBSITE -HTTP://WWW.CHARITIES.AGO.STATE.MA.US/CHARITIES/ AND OTHER SIMILAR TYPES OF WEBSITES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION UPON REQUEST AND ALSO ON THE WEBSITE OF THE MASSACHUSETTS DIVISION OF PUBLIC CHARITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XII, Line 2: Change of Oversight or Selection Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE THEATRE'S FINANCE COMMITTEE OVERSEES AND APPROVES THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGE 12, PART XII, LINE 2C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE THEATRE'S FINANCE COMMITTEE OVERSEES AND APPROVES THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT.
